meanings.definition: A ruler or other person who holds absolute power, typically one who exercises it in a cruel or oppressive way.
meanings.sent1: The despot ruled the land with an iron fist, showing no mercy to the people.
meanings.sent2: The despot's reign of terror came to an end when the people revolted against his tyranny.
meanings.sent3: The despot thought he could control everything, even the weather, by his mere command.
meanings.sent4: Her boss was a despot in the office, crushing any dissenting voices with his power.
meanings.sent5: The despot's face was etched with lines of cruelty, a stark reminder of his oppressive rule.

meanings.definition: A person who wields power oppressively; a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The despot of the playground would not let anyone else play with the ball.
meanings.sent2: The company's despot made unilateral decisions without considering the opinions of others.
meanings.sent3: The despot of the kitchen demanded that all meals be cooked exactly to his liking.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a despot in her own home, dictating rules to her siblings.
meanings.sent5: The despot of the classroom silenced all opposition with a single glare.
